Yes, you can tweek the search code slightly to do this. In your block_simplegooglesearch.php file edit the line: 
```text
$this->content->text = '<center><form method="get" action="http://www.google.com/search"><div style="text-align: center;">
```
 (it should be line 36) so that it reads: 
```text
$this->content->text = '<center><form method="get" action="http://www.google.com/search" target="search results" onsubmit="window.open("", "search results")"><div style="text-align: center;">
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Which RSS format is compatible with Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: Some sites give you one RSS link. But others give you feeds for different sorts of RSS readers. I'm confused. Which format--if any--can I use for moodle? Look here to see what I mean. David

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Which RSS format is compatible with Moodle?
ResponsesInList.Text: In the example you gave, you do not use one of the little buttons - they're designed for specific web-based services. Instead, you use the URL of that exact page - this may surprise you, but that page is not a HTML webpage, it is an Atom newsfeed. It has had stylesheets applied to make it appear like a normal webpage document. "Feedburner" is one well-known service for providing newsfeeds so if you ever see a feedburner page which looks like that, you'll know it's actually a newsfeed. The only alternative is to use your browser's "View source" option (that's how I did it) but that requires you to be able to spot that it's not actually HTML code, which isn't necessarily easy...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: quickmail
ResponsesInList.Text: yes, you are trying to send a mail from a different domain than the one the host is on. in this case you are trying to send mail as if it was from verizon.net when the machine is actually in the bergen domain. if you look at the mail headers, you may see this kinda spelled out in SMTP ... so, what happens is that the recipient's mail server [or some other machine] gets the mail and says, "this says it's from verizon.com but it's actually coming from bergen.com" [or whatever it is]. spammers do this kind of thing all the time [well until it became a well known expolit]. so they get rejected. i think this is what has been happening to your users. unless you want to give all your users bergen.com [or whatever it is] accounts, then you are going to keep running into this problem. blame the spammers!!!

ResponsesInList.Title: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi there, I'm having a problem with the Latest News Block in our Moodle. We have the Latest News Block enabled as a sticky block across the whole site. However, in a few of our courses it does not appear for teachers in those courses. As the Moodle administrator I can see the Latest News Block, but they cannot. This is causing somewhat of an issue for them. This particular teacher is a teacher in about 6 different courses, some of which the Latest News Block appears in, and some it does not. I can't see what differences (if any) exist between these courses and I can't explain whay he can see it in some but not in others. I have added other teachers to these problem courses and they also do not see the Latest News Block, so it appears that the course itself is somehow restricting the view, and it is not related to a specific user. Both courses do have a News Forum included. If you could suggest where I might look to try and resolve this issue, I would really appreciate it. The fact that it is missing in some courses is causing considerable friction.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: I should also point out that there is no option in the Blocks Menu to add the Latest News Block. It simply does not show up in the list of available blocks for teachers in these problem courses. Of course, I see it as an Admin. I also just checked the permissions on the actual News Forum itself... There are no special locally assigned roles, and there are no override permissions in place. I also went through one of the courses where the teacher CAN see the Latest News Block, and compared every setting to the course where the same teacher cannot see the Latest News Block. I cannot see any differences between the two courses in the way they have been set up and optioned. I am at a complete loss as to why this is happening, but it's driving me crazy. Am I correct in assuming taht the News Forum and the Latest News Block are both tied together as one thing? Are there some other settings I should be checking?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: And in the forums where the latest news block does not appear - is there some news? (I mean; in settings are the news items set to a number larger than zero?)

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks Mary, the News Items to Show is set to 5, so that is, unfortunately, not the answer it seems.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: Some things to check (or confirm here). In the courses where the LN block appears is that the sticky block or the local block? Looks for icons along the block header. Is there a difference in the status of the news forums across the courses i.e. some have news posted others do not? I've never set this block as a sticky block but owing to its association with the News Forum I could see this being problematic. I wonder if come of the courses had the LN block enabled before you set it as sticky and they are working OK and the others were created post-stickiness (sorry, I'm losing my grip of the English language here) and they aren't working as the block is not local to the course. The limitation of 1 instance per course might be feeding into this too. So if the risk of extra friction isn't too great, perhaps try removing the stick block and see how that impacts on things...

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: The amazing invisible Latest News Block
ResponsesInList.Text: Fixed it! Tanks to Mary and Ray for your suggestions, and to Tomaz and Martin for looking into it for me. However, the eventual solution was hit upon by Julian Ridden, the Moodleman himself. I had a chat with Julian this morning... he was initially as perplexed as I was, but he eventually worked it out. Turns out the News Forum itself had somehow become corrupted. He fixed it by deleting the News Forum completely, then switching to Social Format (which then created a new Social Forum on the page), and then switching back to Topics Format, (which then created a new News Forum). He then deleted the Social Forum that had been created during the switch to the Social Format, leaving only the new News Forum on the course page. Everything went back to normal with the new News Forum now in place. It turned out to be a simple fix, but it wasn't so obvious as to why it wasn't working (at least not to me) Thanks Moodleman! I owe you (another) beer.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Blocks to only show over specific dates
ResponsesInList.Text: Maybe you want to have a look at my emptyTestBlock Code I published here: http://dev.moodle.org/course/view.php?id=2$ to show how a Block works/has to be programmed (you have to search for emptyTestBlock in the Forums there). This will give you a sense for SERVER-SIDE code. Which means that a program is executed on the server directly gathering all needed data from its database . The Server and the program, i.e. php-script has to RENDER the gathered Data and then send it to the clients' internet browser for display. Gathering Data and Rendering are typical serverside-tasks. On the other end, you have your internet-browser working as CLIENT, as opposed to the SERVER on the other end of the line. Fortunately or strangely, you can even program your internet-browser to execute program-code on its side. Typically you use a programming language called JavaScript. There are many online web-sites to show/teach you how to program with JavaScript. If your Server sends such JavaScript to the internet-browser, that code can be executed locally on the users' computer, e.g. when the user clicks a button or a link. Your serverside php-program can not only gather data and send HTML-formatted Text to be displayed on a client, it can also compose JavaScript, i.e. a program or many many functions to be used and executed on the client. Please click on my sitenavigation to show up in a popUp window here: https://moodle.fhnw.ch/moodleTest/ And if you inspect the HTML- and JavaScript-Code I composed on the Moodle server with php, you will see, that I sent the client a function to open that popUp-window. It is actually this JavaScript-construct that opens the popUp-Window: And this is how I programmed my Block to display/render/send the above line to the client browser: ```text         $this->sitenavigationcontent->text = '" .                               get_string('showinpopupwindow','block_sitenavigation') . ""; ``` To be honest, openpopup() was programmed by the Moodle Core Programmers. So I did not invent/program it. I actually only prepared everything so that when the link is clicked on, the function gets called to show the data I gathered on the server and that should be displayed in the popUp-window. But you could also invent/program your own JavaScript Code/functions and send them to your clients. This is how the Moodle Programmers did it in one of their libraries and how it gets transferred to the client browser: ```text 342 "; ``` Rosario

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Blocks to only show over specific dates
ResponsesInList.Text: I hope my previous post doesn't scare you. It is quite a steep learning curve, if you wanted to learn how to program an own Block in Moodle. Lets return to your basic question: >> If there is no work on this or the resulting work is monstrous (for me) then is there a way I could set the code in my simple html blocks to show one set of html over a specific period of time and another when that period is not true? >> There is a built-in Block called HTML in Moodle ready to use. So everything you put in there DOES NOT COME from the Moodle-Server. If you wanted to display or check values that are stored in the Moodle servers' database, you would have to program your own Moodle Block. And again, you would then be able to decide what to display directly on the server, in your Blocks' php-code. In this case I would not suggest to do it by client side JavaScript. Rosario

ResponsesInList.Text: You can't do this automatically - you would have to go into each course and set the permissions of the block so it was visible only to those with editing rights in the course =teachers SImplest way would be to override permissions so that students cannot view the block.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Sticky Blocks for Teachers Only
ResponsesInList.Text: Well, I've been coming back to this, every now and then, for almost 4 years now.  The best I've been able to come up with is a block that is visible to instructors when they have editing turned on, but not while it's off. It's better than nothing.  If anyone can make it work while editing is turned on, please let me know.  I should add, though, that I've tried many, many different rights settings and they don't seem to behave the way you might think.  For example, you'd think just setting a student to PROHIBIT and a TEACHER to ALLOW would work, but it doesn't. In case anyone might find this useful, here's what I ended up doing: 1.In order to be a "sticky block," it has to be first created on the front page with a Page contents option of "display throughout the entire site." 2.Then enter ANY course and change the "Display on page types" option to "Any type of course main page." At this point, it disappears from the front page and can only be configured further from within a course page.  However, this configuration takes effect regardless of which course it appears in. 3.Next, you have to edit the permissions of the block to remove access from everyone (yes everyone) to view or edit the block (Yes, I said EVERYONE. Adding the teacher to the View block access doesn't do anything, at all.).  Note that while editing is on, anyone with editing rights to the course will still be able to HIDE or MOVE the block, but will not be able to delete it.

ResponsesInList.Text: Hello all, it is first time i post in moodle, i had same problem and it was annoying i seached a lot and also read this post, i solved the problem but i dunno if in a suitable way or not. Anyway here what i have done go to blocks\navigation in ur root moddle directory open renderer.php file and change this line if ($item->has_children() && (!$item->forceopen || $item->collapse)) { to this if ($item->has_children() && ($depth > 1)) { this add the collapsed class to all links in the navigation block whose depth >1 so they are collapsed by default after rendering. For me it is working fine with no problems after, and i did not counter a bug , but not sure it is 100% safe as i am just a programmer and not developing anything in moodle core and does not know if it may affect other aspects though i doubt it. ResponsesInList.Text:


ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Global Search - xPDF!
ResponsesInList.Text: You may check that your IIS is not trapping some execution that is OUTSIDE the document root you gave to IIS for the Moodle code. I experienced some issue of same order with recent PHPs. This is why you'll find a special parameter in global search configuration (system level, acceed through block search configuration) that allow you to consider root you give to executable relative to Moodle installation or absolute. Try to place the xpdf.exe in the moodle code space.

ResponsesInList.Text:
Okay, Let em see if I understand compeltely. I copied pdftotext into the root moodle directory, and checked "Use moodle root for external converters" and used "Path to command pdftotext: pdftotext.exe -eol dos -enc UTF-8 -q" and am still getting: 
```text
Error with pdf to text converter command : execution failed for C:\moodle/pdftotext.exe -eol dos -enc UTF-8 -q "C:\moodledata/2/Outlook_Shared_Calendars.pdf" -. Check for execution permission on pdf converter executable.
```

ResponsesInList.Text:

```text
Executing : C:\moodle/lib/antiword/win32/antiword/antiword.exe -m UTF-8.txt "C:\moodledata/2/Daily_IT_Log_731.doc"
```

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Global Search - xPDF!
ResponsesInList.Text: Thanks for the help - I was able to figure this one out. It was a permission/IIS setup issue, here's the fix I found: Under the IIS MMC, I went to "Information and Internet Services"-->"Web Sites" and right clicked on the moodle site, and then chose "Properties". Clicked to the "Directory Security" tab Click on "Edit" under "Authentication and Access Control" Changed the "Enable Anonymous Access" user from ISUR_{Servername} to { domain }/administrator ; where {servername} is the servers NetBIOS name, and {domain} is the domain the unit lives on. Global search is now indexing correctly. Thanks Again for the Response Cheers JJ

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Side Bar block
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Chris, Speaking from experience, if course pages have sidebar, you are in for a headache when you upgrade. the way sidebar works is that it creates course " sections " starting at section 1000.  When you do an upgrade, the activities and resources are put into sections in the course. I had some courses where the activities ended up  in section 50 and then I had to drag it all the way up. Here is my advice: go through your site and move any activities from all your sidebars into the first available empty section in each course. Afterwards, do the upgrade. Once the upgrade is done, install the "Section" block. What this block does is it essentially duplicates the content of a section that you specify in a block.  So, for example, if you move a sidebars activity into section 15, you can add a Section Block and set it to display Section 15. To edit the block, you actually edit the actual section instead. I've been using it and it works pretty well.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Center column
ResponsesInList.Text: You can add a single text section at the top-centre of your frontpage. To enable it, go to your admin menu, and click " Front page " -> "Front page settings". ResponsesInList.Text: The mdl_resource table. Steve

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Where is the data from an HTML Block stored?
ResponsesInList.Text:
Unfortunately, the data for each block (including the HTML block) is serialized, then base64encoded and stored inside the `configdata` field of the `mdl_block_instance` table. That's why it will be hard to write a mysql query to update a lot of HTML blocks at once. If you know PHP you can use 
```text
  unserialize(base64_decode($instance->configdata))
```
 to get at the real values.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: default blocks in new courses
ResponsesInList.Text:
Greetings, Mark! Did you follow these directions? (They were also in moodle.docs, but I am getting a strange string when I go there, so I am sending you back to the original thread.) http://moodle.org/mod/forum/discuss.php?d=24239 Look for Daryl Hawes post on Tuesday, May 24, 2005 The key is: $CFG->defaultblocks_topics =
'participants,activity_modules,search_forums,admin,course_list:news_items,calendar_upcoming,recent_activity'; Notice that this line only affects the topics courses; you have to selectively change lines depending on what you want to happen with the blocks. Be careful that you use the name of the block as installed. The : is important too, separating what is on the right and left sides. $CFG->defaultblocks_topics = 'course_menu,course_list:activity_modules,calendar_upcoming,quickmail';

ResponsesInList.Title: Preventing blocks from being deleted
ResponsesInList.Text: In Moodle 2.x, the admin can mark certain types of block so that they can never be deleted. By default, this is used to make it impossible to delete the settings or the navigation blocks. If you delete those, you can be stuck as there is no way to turn editing back on, and add them back. (If you did not know about this, go to Admin -> Plugins -> Blocks -> Manage blocks, and look for the padlock icons.) Now that is great if you are an admin who has just set up a really complex blocks configuration, and you don't want anyone to mess it up. However, the way the code works is not that simple. The rules that were implemented were actually: A block cannot be deleted if ALL of these are true: The type of block is protected on the manage blocks page; The block's parent context is the system context; and The block is set to show on all pages, or just on the site index page. We (the Open University) don't see any benefit to having conditions 2. and 3. We have some blocks that are set to show up on all pages for type course-view-*, and idiots keep deleting them! Therefore, I have raised MDL-35964 to propose changing how this features works, so that if a type of block is set to be undeletable, then really no one can delete it. If someone really need to delete one of those blocks, then the admin can temporarily un-protect it while it is added or deleted, and then it can be protected again (or not). Anyway, that is what we would like to do, but we would like you feedback about whether it is a good idea or not. Please comment in this forum thread, on in the tracker issue.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Javascript problem in block & forums
ResponsesInList.Text: I've found that the forums will just strip out an javascript code in forum posts before they are displayed. The javascript can be in the database fine, but the php will strip it out. The same with stuff like iframes. In the Admin->Security->Site Policy there is the "Enable Trusted Content" setting: By default Moodle will always thoroughly clean text that comes from users to remove any possible bad scripts, media etc that could be a security risk. The Trusted Content system is a way of giving partcular users that you trust the ability to include these advanced features in their content without interference. To enable this system, you need to first enable this setting, and then grant the Trusted Content permission to a specific Moodle role. Texts created or uploaded by such users will be marked as trusted and will not be cleaned before display. I haven't fully tried it yet, but that is probably a place to start.

ResponsesInList.Title: Quickmail Sends Zip Files ... why?

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Quickmail Sends Zip Files ... why?
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Mark, I think the zip file is to try to ensure the attachment is received by as many of the recipients as possible. Some email systems are picky as to the type of attachments they will receive whereas almost all will happily receive zip files. Hotmail and Google will reject emails that have certain file types attached to protect their users. e.g. If you were to attach an .exe file it will almost certainly be rejected by most email servers but the zip would arrive. Whether this is good or bad is a discussion in itself.

White screen is an issue with the path to confirm.php. You need to ensure that the details in the ELGG config.php $CFG->lmshosts = array('MECMoodle' => array('token' => 'passwd', 'networkaddress' => '10.1.1.10,'confirmurl' => ' http://www.yoursite.com/moodle/blocks/eportfolio/confirm.php' , 'baseurl' => ' http://www.yoursite.com/moodle' , 'name' => 'Moodle')); And in moodle this stuff is pointing to the right place block_eportfolio_server: yoursite.com Hostname of your e-portfolio server , eg myeportfolio.com. block_eportfolio_token: passwd Shared token for your e-portfolio server. It's very important that your e-portfolio server has been set up with the same token block_eportfolio_networkaddress: 10.1.1.10 Network address of your e-portfolio server. Can be a full exact address like 192.168.0.1 or a partial address like 192.168 or CIDR notation, such as 231.54.211.0/20. This is what identifies all communication between moodle and the e-portfolio system. ResponsesInList.Title: install Gong in Apache server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi people, i need install the Gong in Apache server (apache2), now the gong need a apache tomcat, but my server don't have this, so is possible install the gong in apache 2? somebody can helpme? thanks

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: install Gong in Apache server
ResponsesInList.Text: Hi Apache2 is meant for CGI /PHP scripts + talking to databases (usually mySQL , Access, SQL Server or anything you can get an ODBC data connection to). Apache Tomact is designed for running java servlets, so it's unlikely you can get away from it (unless this Gong thing has a PHP version?) - if you have root/admin access to the server, your best bet is to install Apache Tomcat, make sure you have the mod_proxy + mod_proxy_ajp options installed/enabled then setup a proxy instruction the apache config file once you've setup Gong - bear in mind tomcat will need a separate port, but this doesn't need to be opened up to the outside world - as long as your apache server can see this port (eg if it's within same server or LAN) it should be ok. Dave

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Block Visibility
ResponsesInList.Text: Bingo. The Authenticated User role undergirds all users all the time (except admins).  Other roles are stacked on top of it. Prohibiting a capability prevents access completely, even if allowed by another role in a more specific context .  So if you prohibit a capability in the Auth User role, it's super-duper-gold-star-no-no prohibited. So, edit the permissions on the blocks to allow viewing to the Auth User.  That should clear it up for your instructors.  If you still want to hide the Nav block on the frontpage, instead prohibit View Block for Authenticated User on the Frontpage in the block's Permissions and assign that role to your instructors on the frontpage.  As far as your Activity block, on the frontpage you'll have to pick between showing it to everyone or noone. As long as you don't prohibit the Auth User, the roles at the course level will properly control visibility.

ResponsesInList.Title: Re: Mass Actions - permissions
ResponsesInList.Text: Answering my own question here: It was a permissions thing under: Site administration ► Users ► Permissions ► Define Roles Not a mass actions problem at all. Cheers, Sam.
